member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppArray
member.summary: Defines a one-dimensional array capable of storing integer or real values. Declaration syntax: array int|real arrayName size

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppArray.Size
member.summary: Returns the total number of elements in the array.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts and assigns the array declaration details from the command parameters.
member.param: The stored program this array belongs to
The argument string following the array keyword

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation is not required for this command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.Compile
member.summary: Allocates memory for the array and registers it within the program.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.Execute
member.summary: Arrays do not require runtime execution.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.GetIntArray(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves an integer element from the array at the specified index.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.GetRealArray(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a real (double) element from the array at the specified index.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.SetIntArray(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Assigns an integer value to the array at the given index.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.SetRealArray(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Assigns a real (double) value to the array at the given index.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.IsIntArray
member.summary: Indicates whether the array stores integer values.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppArray.IsRealArray
member.summary: Indicates whether the array stores real (double) values.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppAsign
member.summary: Implements assignment functionality for variables that have already been declared. Supported syntax: "set varName = expression" or "varName = expression". Example usages include "set x = 10" and "x = y + 5". This command modifies the value of an existing variable without creating a new one.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppAsign.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the assignment command. Required for instantiation via the CommandFactory.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppAsign.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Associates the command with the current stored program and parses the assignment input. Separates the variable name and the expression from the assignment statement.
member.param: The stored program currently being executed
Assignment text in the form "varName = expression"
member.exception: Thrown when the assignment statement does not follow the expected format

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppAsign.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter checking is not required for this command. Method is implemented to satisfy the ICommand interface.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppAsign.Compile
member.summary: Compilation stage for the assignment command. No compilation logic is required as validation occurs during execution.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppAsign.Execute
member.summary: Executes the assignment by evaluating the expression and updating the target variable. Supports both literal values and computed expressions, with appropriate type validation.
member.exception: Thrown when the target variable does not exist, the expression is invalid, or the evaluated value cannot be assigned due to a type mismatch

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean
member.summary: Custom Boolean implementation that avoids the default BOOSE Boolean limitations by extending the Evaluation class. Supports declaration and optional initialization using true/false literals or evaluatable expressions. Expression results are interpreted numerically, where non-zero represents true and zero represents false.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AppBoolean class. Required for creation via the command factory.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean.BoolValue
member.summary: Gets or assigns the underlying boolean value.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean.Value
member.summary: Provides integer compatibility for the base Evaluation class. True is represented as 1, while false is represented as 0.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Interprets the declaration parameters. Supports both simple declarations (e.g., "flag") and initialized declarations (e.g., "flag = true", "flag = expression").

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean.Compile
member.summary: Registers the boolean variable during compilation and evaluates any provided initializer.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean.Execute
member.summary: Executes boolean expression evaluation and converts the result into a boolean value. Numeric results are interpreted such that non-zero values are true and zero represents false.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppBoolean.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation is not required for this command. Method is implemented to satisfy interface requirements.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppCall
member.summary: Provides support for invoking user-defined methods with argument passing and optional return value handling. Call syntax: "call methodName [arg1 arg2 ...]". Example usage: "call mulMethod 10 5". This command manages parameter binding, return variable setup, and program counter redirection to simulate a standard function call.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCall.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the AppCall command. Required for instantiation through the CommandFactory.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCall.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Associates the command with the active stored program and parses the method name and argument list from the call statement.
member.param: The stored program currently being executed
Call arguments in the form "methodName arg1 arg2 ..."
member.exception: Thrown when the call statement does not include a method name

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCall.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation is not required for the call command. This method exists to satisfy the ICommand interface.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCall.Compile
member.summary: No compilation logic is required for method calls. Method existence and argument validation occur at runtime.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCall.Execute
member.summary: Executes the method call by resolving the target method, creating local parameter variables, preparing a return location, and transferring control to the method body. This mirrors the behavior of a function call in conventional languages.
member.exception: Thrown when the stored program is not an AppStoredProgram or when the specified method cannot be found
Thrown when the number of supplied arguments does not match the method's parameter definition

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCall.EvaluateExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates an argument expression by substituting variable references with their current values prior to evaluation. Returns the final evaluated result as a string.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas
member.summary: Implements the ICanvas interface to provide drawing functionality. This class uses the Singleton design pattern to guarantee that only one canvas instance is created and shared across the application.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas._instance
member.summary: Holds the single shared instance of the AppCanvas.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas._lock
member.summary: Synchronization object used to ensure thread-safe creation of the singleton instance.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.displayControl
member.summary: Reference to the PictureBox control responsible for displaying the canvas.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new AppCanvas instance. The constructor is private to prevent external instantiation and enforce the Singleton pattern.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Instance(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the global AppCanvas instance, creating it if necessary.
member.param: Canvas width (used only on first creation)
Canvas height (used only on first creation)

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.LinkToPictureBox(System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox)
member.summary: Associates the canvas bitmap with a PictureBox for rendering.
member.param: PictureBox used to display the canvas

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.RefreshDisplay
member.summary: Forces the display control to repaint and show the latest drawing updates.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Xpos
member.summary: Gets or sets the current horizontal position of the drawing cursor.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Ypos
member.summary: Gets or sets the current vertical position of the drawing cursor.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.PenColour
member.summary: Gets or sets the current pen colour.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Circle(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a circle centred at the current cursor position.
member.param: Indicates whether the circle should be filled

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Reset
member.summary: Resets the canvas to its initial state, clearing all drawings and restoring default cursor and pen settings.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Clear
member.summary: Clears all drawings from the canvas.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.DrawTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a line from the current cursor position to the specified point.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.MoveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the drawing cursor to the specified location without drawing.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Rect(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a rectangle using the current cursor position as the top-left corner.
member.param: Indicates whether the rectangle should be filled

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Set(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes the canvas and reinitializes the drawing surface.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.SetColour(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the pen colour using individual RGB components.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.Tri(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws an outlined triangle at the current cursor position.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.WriteText(System.String)
member.summary: Renders text at the current cursor position.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.penSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the pen thickness used for drawing operations.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.getBitmap
member.summary: Retrieves the current bitmap representing the canvas contents.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCanvas.ResetInstance
member.summary: Resets the singleton instance, allowing a new canvas to be created on the next request.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppCircle
member.summary: Custom Circle command for the BOOSE language. Draws a circle on the canvas using a radius that can be a literal value or an evaluated expression at runtime. Optionally supports a filled flag.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCircle.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Creates a new AppCircle command using the provided canvas.
member.param: Canvas used to draw the circle.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCircle.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns the current StoredProgram and parses the parameter string. Parameters are split by comma to preserve expressions.
member.param: Parameter string containing radius and optional filled flag.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCircle.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Checks that the number of parameters is valid.
member.param: List of parameters passed to the command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCircle.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the command and determines whether the circle should be filled if a second parameter is provided.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCircle.Execute
member.summary: Executes the Circle command. Evaluates the radius expression at runtime and optionally evaluates a filled flag before drawing the circle.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppClear
member.summary: Implements the Clear command for the BOOSE language. Clears the entire canvas and removes all drawn content.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppClear.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Creates a new AppClear command using the specified canvas.
member.param: Canvas to be cleared when the command executes.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppClear.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns the StoredProgram reference for the command. The Clear command does not accept any parameters.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppClear.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that no parameters are supplied to the Clear command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppClear.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the Clear command. No compilation logic is required.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppClear.Execute
member.summary: Executes the Clear command by clearing the canvas.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppCommandFactory
member.summary: Application-specific command factory. Responsible for creating BOOSE commands supported by MYBooseApp. Extends the base CommandFactory to register custom drawing, variable, control-flow, and method-related commands.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCommandFactory.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AppCommandFactory.
member.param: Reference to the application canvas used by drawing commands.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppCommandFactory.MakeCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and returns an ICommand instance based on the supplied command type.
member.param: The command keyword parsed from the BOOSE program (e.g. "circle", "if", "call").
member.returns: A new ICommand instance corresponding to the specified command.
member.exception: Thrown when the command type is not recognised.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo
member.summary: Implements the DrawTo command for the BOOSE language. Draws a straight line from the current pen position to the specified X and Y coordinates on the canvas.
member.remarks: Coordinate values are evaluated at runtime and may be numeric literals, variables, or arithmetic expressions.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.Canvas
member.summary: Canvas used to perform drawing operations.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.program
member.summary: Reference to the stored program for expression evaluation.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.Parameters
member.summary: Array containing the raw command parameters.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the command.
member.param: The canvas on which the line will be drawn.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns the stored program reference and parses command parameters.
member.param: A parameter string containing X and Y coordinate expressions.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that exactly two parameters are supplied.
member.exception: Thrown when the command does not receive exactly two parameters.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the DrawTo command.
member.remarks: Parameter evaluation is deferred until execution time.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppDrawTo.Execute
member.summary: Executes the DrawTo command by evaluating the X and Y expressions and drawing a line to the resulting coordinates.
member.exception: Thrown when coordinate expressions cannot be evaluated or do not result in valid integer values.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppElse
member.summary: Represents the 'else' branch in an if-else conditional statement.
member.remarks: Syntax: "else". This command is executed when the preceding 'if' condition is FALSE. When executed, it skips over the else block to the matching 'end if' command. Supports nested if-else statements by tracking nesting levels.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppElse.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for the command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppElse.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and validates that no parameters are provided.
member.param: Reference to the stored program being executed.
member.exception: Thrown if any parameters are provided.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppElse.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates command parameters.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppElse.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the 'else' command.
member.remarks: No compilation steps are required for this command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppElse.Execute
member.summary: Executes the 'else' command by skipping to the corresponding 'end if'.
member.remarks: Handles nested if-else structures by tracking nesting levels.
member.exception: Thrown if the command is not running under or if no matching 'end if' is found.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor
member.summary: Represents the end of a for loop and manages loop iteration.
member.remarks: Syntax: "end for" or "endfor". Increments the loop variable and returns execution to the corresponding for statement to evaluate the loop condition and continue iteration.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.correspondingFor
member.summary: Reference to the matching command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required for instantiation via .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and validates parameters. Only accepts an empty string or "for" (split from "end for").
member.param: Reference to the stored program being executed.
member.exception: Thrown if invalid parameters are provided.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates command parameters.
member.remarks: No action required for the 'end for' command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.Compile
member.summary: Links this EndFor command to its corresponding during compilation. Pops the AppFor from the program stack and stores the link.
member.exception: Thrown if the popped command is not a valid .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.Execute
member.summary: Executes the end for command by incrementing the loop variable and jumping back to the corresponding for statement for iteration.
member.exception: Thrown if the command was not properly compiled.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.GetLoopVariableName
member.summary: Retrieves the loop variable name from the corresponding .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndFor.GetIncrementValue
member.summary: Retrieves the increment value from the corresponding .

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppEndIf
member.summary: Represents the end of an if/else block in the BOOSE language. Serves as a marker to indicate where an if/else statement finishes. Execution of this command has no effect; it is only used for control flow.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndIf.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required for instantiation via .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndIf.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and validates parameters. Accepts an empty string or "if" (when parser splits "end if" into "end" + "if").
member.param: Reference to the stored program being executed.
member.exception: Thrown if invalid parameters are provided.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndIf.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation (not required for AppEndIf).

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndIf.Compile
member.summary: Compilation step (not required for AppEndIf).

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndIf.Execute
member.summary: Execution step (not required for AppEndIf). This command is used as a marker for control flow only.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod
member.summary: Represents the end of a method declaration in the BOOSE language. Serves as a marker indicating the method body has finished. When executed, it removes local parameters and returns control to the calling instruction. Syntax: "end method" or "end".

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.correspondingMethod
member.summary: Reference to the corresponding AppMethod command for this EndMethod.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.returnAddress
member.summary: The program counter (PC) address to return to after method execution.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required for instantiation via .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and validates parameters. Accepts an empty string or "method" (when parser splits "end method" into "end" + "method").
member.param: Reference to the stored program being executed.
member.exception: Thrown if invalid parameters are provided.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation (not required for AppEndMethod).

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.Compile
member.summary: Compilation step: Links this EndMethod with its corresponding AppMethod. Pops the method from the BOOSE compilation stack and stores the reference.
member.exception: Thrown if no matching method is found or type mismatch occurs.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.SetReturnAddress(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the program counter address to return to after method execution. Called by when invoking the method.
member.param: Program counter (PC) of the instruction after the call.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndMethod.Execute
member.summary: Executes the EndMethod command. Cleans up method parameters (local variables) and returns control to the calling instruction.
member.exception: Thrown if EndMethod is executed without a return address.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppEndWhile
member.summary: Represents the end of a while loop in the BOOSE language. Serves as a marker to return control to the corresponding for condition evaluation. Syntax: "end while" or "endwhile". Uses a forward-scanning mechanism—no backward linking is required.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppEndWhile.correspondingWhile
member.summary: Reference to the corresponding command. Established during compilation.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndWhile.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required for instantiation via .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndWhile.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and validates parameters. Only allows an empty string or "while" (when parser splits "end while").
member.param: Reference to the stored program being executed.
Optional parameter, should be empty or "while".
member.exception: Thrown if invalid parameters are provided.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndWhile.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation is not required for EndWhile.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndWhile.Compile
member.summary: Compilation phase: Pops the corresponding from the stack and stores a reference for execution.
member.exception: Thrown if no matching while statement is found.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppEndWhile.Execute
member.summary: Execution phase: Sets the program counter (PC) to the corresponding so the loop condition can be re-evaluated.
member.exception: Thrown if EndWhile was not properly compiled or linked.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppFor
member.summary: Represents a "for" loop in the BOOSE language with initialization, condition checking, and automatic increment. Syntax: "for varName = start to end [step increment]". Example usage: "for i = 0 to 10 step 1" or "for i = 0 to 10" (step defaults to 1).

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppFor.varName
member.summary: Name of the loop variable (e.g., "i").

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppFor.startValue
member.summary: Expression representing the starting value of the loop variable.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppFor.endValue
member.summary: Expression representing the end value of the loop variable.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppFor.increment
member.summary: Expression representing the increment/step value (defaults to "1" if omitted).

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppFor.forIndex
member.summary: Index of this for loop command in the stored program.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppFor.endForIndex
member.summary: Index of the corresponding EndFor command in the stored program.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required for instantiation via .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.GetVarName
member.summary: Gets the name of the loop variable for use by .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.GetIncrement
member.summary: Gets the evaluated increment value for use by .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the for loop by parsing the loop parameters. Expected format: "for varName = start to end [step increment]".
member.param: Reference to the stored program being executed.
String containing loop parameters including variable, start, end, and optional step.
member.exception: Thrown if parameters are invalid or missing.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation is not needed for the for loop command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.Compile
member.summary: Compilation phase: Records the position of this for loop in the program and pushes it onto the stack. The corresponding will pop this command to establish a bidirectional link.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.SetEndForIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the position of the corresponding during compilation.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.GetForIndex
member.summary: Returns the position of this for loop in the stored program. Used by for jumping back to the loop start.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.Execute
member.summary: Executes the for loop: initializes the loop variable, evaluates the loop condition, and either continues to the loop body or jumps past the loop if the condition is false.
member.exception: Thrown if the program is not an .
Thrown if the step value is zero.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppFor.EvaluateIntExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates an integer expression with variable substitution.
member.exception: Thrown if evaluation fails.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppIf
member.summary: Represents an 'if' conditional command in BOOSE. Evaluates a boolean condition and controls execution flow accordingly. Supports nested if-else structures when used with .

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppIf.condition
member.summary: Stores the condition expression provided by the user.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppIf.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for instantiation via .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppIf.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the command with the stored program and captures the condition expression.
member.exception: Thrown if the condition is empty or null.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppIf.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: No additional parameter validation required beyond .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppIf.Compile
member.summary: Compilation phase does not require special actions for if.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppIf.Execute
member.summary: Executes the 'if' command by evaluating the condition. If true, execution continues normally. If false, jumps to the matching (if present) or .
member.exception: Thrown if no matching end-if is found.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppIf.EvaluateCondition(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates the boolean condition string using variable substitution.
member.returns: True if the condition evaluates to true, otherwise false.
member.exception: Thrown if evaluation fails.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppMethod
member.summary: Represents a custom method declaration in BOOSE. Handles parsing of return type, method name, parameters, and supports control flow management. Example syntax: "method int mulMethod int one, int two"

member.summary: The return type of the method ("int", "real", or empty for void)

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.methodName
member.summary: The name of the method

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.parameters
member.summary: List of parameters as tuples of (type, name)

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.methodEndIndex
member.summary: Index of the corresponding end of the method

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for CommandFactory

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the method declaration by parsing the provided string. Extracts optional return type, required method name, and optional parameters.
member.param: Method declaration string in the format "[returnType] methodName [type param1, type param2, ...]"

member.summary: Compilation phase: records position, registers method in AppStoredProgram, and pushes to stack
member.exception: Thrown if AppStoredProgram is not used

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.SetEndMethodIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the index of the corresponding end of the method

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.GetMethodStartIndex
member.summary: Returns the method's starting position in the program

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.GetMethodName
member.summary: Returns the method's name

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.GetReturnType
member.summary: Returns the return type of the method

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.GetParameters
member.summary: Returns the method's parameter list

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMethod.Execute
member.summary: Execution phase: skips method body if reached directly; should only execute via AppCall
member.exception: Thrown if end position is not set

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppMoveTo
member.summary: Implements the MoveTo command for moving the pen to specified coordinates. Supports both literal integers and expressions/variables from the stored program.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMoveTo.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with a reference to the canvas.
member.param: The canvas on which to move the pen

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMoveTo.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and splits the parameter string.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMoveTo.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that exactly two parameters are provided.
member.exception: Thrown if the number of parameters is not two

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMoveTo.Compile
member.summary: Compilation phase. MoveTo evaluates expressions at runtime. Ensures parameter count is correct.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppMoveTo.Execute
member.summary: Executes the MoveTo command by evaluating X and Y coordinates and moving the pen to the computed position on the canvas.
member.exception: Thrown when the X or Y parameter cannot be evaluated to a valid integer.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppPeek
member.summary: Implements the 'peek' command for reading a value from a 1D array into a variable. Syntax: peek targetVar = arrayName index Supports both integer and real arrays.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPeek.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required by CommandFactory.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPeek.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the peek command parameters. Expects format: targetVar = arrayName index
member.param: Command string containing target variable, array name, and index
member.exception: Thrown if the format is invalid

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPeek.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: No additional parameter validation required.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPeek.Compile
member.summary: Compilation phase: Validates that the array and target variable exist and types are compatible.
member.exception: Thrown if variables are missing or types mismatch

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPeek.Execute
member.summary: Execution phase: Evaluates the index and reads the value from the array into the target variable.
member.exception: Thrown if the index cannot be evaluated to an integer or there is a type mismatch.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppPen
member.summary: Implements the 'Pen' command to set the drawing color on the canvas. Accepts three parameters (R, G, B) which can be literals or expressions. RGB values must be integers in the 0–255 range.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPen.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Creates a new AppPen command linked to a specific canvas.
member.param: The canvas where the pen color will be applied.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPen.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and splits the parameters into R, G, B.
member.param: RGB parameters separated by comma or space

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPen.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that exactly three parameters are provided for the command.
member.exception: Thrown if parameter count is not exactly 3

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPen.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the command by verifying parameter count.
member.exception: Thrown if parameter count is not exactly 3

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPen.Execute
member.summary: Executes the Pen command by evaluating each parameter expression and setting the pen color on the canvas.
member.exception: Thrown if a parameter is invalid, cannot be converted to an integer, is out of the 0–255 range, or if setting the color fails.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPen.EvaluateColorParameter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Helper method to evaluate a single color parameter.
member.exception: Thrown if evaluation fails or value is invalid

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppPenSize
member.summary: Implements the 'PenSize' command to set the width of the pen on the canvas. Accepts a single parameter, which can be a literal integer or a BOOSE expression.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPenSize.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a canvas reference.
member.param: The canvas where the pen width will be applied.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPenSize.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and splits the parameter string into an array.
member.param: Reference to the current stored program.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPenSize.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that exactly one parameter is provided.
member.exception: Thrown if parameter count is not exactly one.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPenSize.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the command by checking parameter count. Evaluation of the pen width is deferred to runtime.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPenSize.Execute
member.summary: Executes the PenSize command by evaluating the parameter and applying it to the canvas.
member.exception:
Thrown if:
The expression cannot be evaluated
The evaluated value is not an integer
The pen size is less than or equal to zero

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPenSize.EvaluatePenWidth(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method to evaluate the pen width parameter.
member.exception: Thrown if the parameter cannot be evaluated to a valid integer

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppPoke
member.summary: Implements the 'poke' command to assign a value to a 1D array element. Syntax: poke arrayName index = value Supports integer and real arrays, with index and value evaluated as expressions if needed.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPoke.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPoke.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the 'poke' command parameters. Splits the left-hand side into array name and index, right-hand side into value.
member.param: Parameter string in the form: "arrayName index = value"
member.exception: Thrown if syntax is invalid

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPoke.Compile
member.summary: Validates array existence and type during compilation.
member.exception: Thrown if array does not exist or is not an AppArray

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPoke.Execute
member.summary: Executes the 'poke' command at runtime. Evaluates index and value expressions and assigns the value to the array.
member.exception: Thrown for invalid index, value, or array type

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPoke.EvaluateIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method to evaluate the index expression to an integer.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppPoke.EvaluateValue(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method to evaluate the value expression to a double.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppReal
member.summary: Represents a real (double-precision) variable in the BOOSE language. Supports declaration with optional initialization and runtime expression evaluation.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReal.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppReal.RealValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual double value of the variable.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppReal.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer representation of the variable. Provides compatibility with BOOSE's base class.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReal.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the variable suitable for expression evaluation. Uses up to 15 significant digits in general format.
member.returns: The string representation of the real value.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReal.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the program reference and parses the variable declaration. Supports optional initialization via an expression.
member.param: The stored program managing this variable.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReal.Compile
member.summary: Registers the variable with the program and evaluates any initializer expression. Called during compilation.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReal.Execute
member.summary: Re-evaluates the variable's expression and updates its value at runtime. Only executes if an expression was defined.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReal.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: No additional parameter validation is required for .

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppRect
member.summary: Represents a rectangle drawing command in the BOOSE language. Draws a rectangle on the canvas using width and height expressions, and optionally supports a filled flag.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppRect.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a reference to the application canvas.
member.param: The canvas used for rendering the rectangle.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppRect.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and splits the parameter string.
member.param: The stored program associated with this command.
Comma or space-separated parameters: width height [filled].

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppRect.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates the parameter count for the rectangle command.
member.exception: Thrown if the number of parameters is less than 2 or greater than 3.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppRect.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the rectangle command and determines the filled flag if provided.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppRect.Execute
member.summary: Executes the rectangle command. Evaluates width, height, and optional filled flag, then draws the rectangle.
member.exception: Thrown if width or height expressions are invalid, dimensions are non-positive, filled flag is invalid, or if the canvas fails to render the rectangle.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppReset
member.summary: Represents the Reset command for the BOOSE language. Resets the canvas state to its default settings.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReset.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified canvas.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReset.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and initializes parameters. Reset does not require any parameters.
member.param: The stored program associated with this command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReset.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates parameters for the Reset command. Ensures that no extra parameters are provided.
member.exception: Thrown if any parameters are provided to the Reset command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReset.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the Reset command. No compilation logic is required for this command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppReset.Execute
member.summary: Executes the Reset command by resetting the canvas to its default state.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram
member.summary: Extended version of with support for custom method registration and enhanced runtime execution.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.methodRegistry
member.summary: Registry of method names to their start indices in the command list.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified canvas.
member.param: The canvas on which commands will operate.

member.name: P:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.CommandCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of commands in the program.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.RegisterMethod(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers a custom method by name and the index of its first command.
member.param: The index of the first command of the method.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.GetMethodStartIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the start index of a registered method.
member.returns: The start index of the method.
member.exception: Thrown if the method does not exist.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.MethodExists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a method with the specified name exists.
member.returns: True if the method exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.GetCommand(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the command at the specified index.
member.returns: The command at the given index.
member.exception: Thrown if the index is out of range or the item is not an .

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppStoredProgram.Run
member.summary: Executes the stored program, iterating through all commands. Detects potential infinite loops and reports syntax or runtime errors.
member.exception: Thrown if the program contains syntax errors or a runtime exception occurs.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppTri
member.summary: Command class for drawing a triangle on the canvas. Evaluates width and height at runtime, allowing the use of literal integers or expressions involving BOOSE variables.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppTri.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters provided to the triangle command.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppTri.Canvas
member.summary: Reference to the canvas on which the triangle is drawn.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppTri.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppTri.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and splits the command parameters.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppTri.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that exactly two parameters (width and height) are provided.
member.exception: Thrown if the parameter count is not exactly two.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppTri.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the triangle command. Runtime evaluation of width and height occurs in .
member.exception: Thrown if parameters are missing or invalid.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppTri.Execute
member.summary: Executes the triangle drawing command. Evaluates width and height expressions and draws the triangle on the canvas.
member.exception: Thrown if width or height is invalid or non-positive.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppWhile
member.summary: Implements a while loop command for BOOSE. Repeatedly executes the loop body as long as the condition expression evaluates to true. Supports nested loops using forward-scanning and an internal counter variable. Syntax: "while condition"

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.condition
member.summary: The condition expression to evaluate for continuing the loop.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.whileIndex
member.summary: The index of this AppWhile command in the program. Used by AppEndWhile to jump back to the loop start.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.internalCounterVar
member.summary: Unique internal counter variable name for this loop instance.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required for CommandFactory instantiation.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and parses the loop condition. Creates a unique internal counter variable for this instance.
member.param: Condition expression for the while loop.
member.exception: Thrown if the condition is missing or empty.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Parameter validation for ICommand interface. No parameters are required for while.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.Compile
member.summary: Compilation phase: Records this command's index in the program. Pushes this command onto the stack for linking with AppEndWhile.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.Execute
member.summary: Executes the while loop by evaluating the condition and managing loop iterations. Handles nested loops with forward-scanning to the matching EndWhile command.
member.exception: Thrown if AppStoredProgram is not used or no matching EndWhile is found.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.GetWhileIndex
member.summary: Gets the program index of this while command. Used by AppEndWhile for loop control.
member.returns: The index of this AppWhile in the program.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWhile.EvaluateCondition(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates a boolean condition expression with variable substitution. Supports comparison and logical operators.
member.returns: True if the condition evaluates to true, otherwise false.
member.exception: Thrown if the condition cannot be evaluated.

member.name: T:MYBooseApp.AppWrite
member.summary: Command to write text or variable values on the canvas. Supports string literals, int and real variables, and expressions. Concatenates multiple parts using the '+' operator.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.Canvas
member.summary: Reference to the canvas where text will be drawn.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.program
member.summary: Reference to the stored program to evaluate expressions and fetch variable values.

member.name: F:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.Parameter
member.summary: The raw parameter string passed to the write command.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.#ctor(BOOSE.ICanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The canvas on which text will be written.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the stored program reference and parameter string for this command.
member.param: The parameter string, which can be a literal, variable, or expression.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that the parameter string is not empty.
member.param: Array of parameters (not used in this command).
member.exception: Thrown if the parameter is null or empty.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the command by trimming leading and trailing spaces from the parameter.

member.name: M:MYBooseApp.AppWrite.Execute
member.summary: Executes the write command. Evaluates expressions and variables, handles string literals, and concatenates parts with the '+' operator.

T:AppInt
member.summary: Represents an integer variable in BOOSE with support for declaration and assignment. Supports "int x", "int x = 50", and "x = expression" forms.

member.name: F:AppInt.intValue
member.summary: Stores the integer value of this variable.

member.name: M:AppInt.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for use by .

member.name: P:AppInt.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer value stored in this command.

member.name: M:AppInt.Set(BOOSE.StoredProgram,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the variable by parsing the name and optional assignment expression.

member.name: M:AppInt.Compile
member.summary: Compilation phase: Registers the variable in the program and evaluates the initial expression.
member.exception: Thrown if variable or program state is invalid.
Thrown if the initial expression cannot be evaluated as an integer.

member.name: M:AppInt.Execute
member.summary: Executes the assignment of a value to the variable at runtime. Evaluates the expression and updates the program variable.
member.exception: Thrown if expression cannot be evaluated as an integer.

member.name: M:AppInt.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: No parameter validation is required for this command.
